It will depend on the checks, if they pass it will approve if not it will request changes.

### Screenshots

author: Bashamega

comments.body: Thank you for the suggestion. But this will make the project a mess and knowledge transfer will bee lost.

title: [FEATURE] Validate repository ownership/maintainability
body:
### Description

I don't know if it's possible, but adding validation whether the one adding the repository can actually maintain it would be nice.

This would prevent outside parties from adding my repository.
This is not an issue right now, but if you also want to prevent duplicate repositories, this would be one way of doing it.

Goes well with #203

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
author: renenielsendk

comments.body:
Yep this is something that can be done, but some people wanted to make suggestions to the repo that they might only contribute to, so we left it open to be able to add any public repo.

If the maintainer adds the repo, they get a bit more information, for example the traffic stats of the repo.

I will close this suggestion for now, as I am keen to keep things more "open" for now to get more feedback. 

Thank you for raising though.

title: [BUG]¬†My repositories are added multiple times.
body:
### Description

I personally don't think it should be possible adding the same repository twice. Do some kind of validation on the URL.

This would also prevent the system from being flooded with duplicates.
This is normally not an issue if the scope of the things added is the same user, but when having lists of "All repositories" and similar, this will start to become an issue, if the same repository occurs multiple times.

Could possibly be linked with #204 

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
author: renenielsendk

comments.body:
I don't see this happening too often, I think people will only add repos they are interested in. 

We could use this metric of how many times a repo has been added - it could make a fun page.

I agree it would be more efficient to have a single source of truth per repo.

But as this is not an issue for now, I am going to close, but something we could consider in the future - thank you for the feedback

title: Synced local files to container files
body:
Fixes Issue: -  Change in docker compose.yaml 

Closes  #167

## Changes proposed

Added a volume over the 
Local files to container files i.e. .:/usr/src/app
And another for node modules so that they don't overlap i.e. /usr/src/app/node_modules

title: [FEATURE] Limit how many repos + checks can be added per user
body:
### Description

The data could get very large, so we need to have a limit of how many repos can be added

1. display total and remaining (10 repos)
2. disable add button and server action if limit reached
3. limit how many checks can be done per repo, display total and remaining (10 checks)
4. disable the run button and server action if limit reached

Qs.
1. ~~should the repo have a delete button?~~ this can come later after it is deployed and we have user feedback
2. ~~should the checks have a delete button or expire after a certain amount of time?~~ same as point 1 above


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

comments.body: I am willing to work on this if you are looking for someone @eddiejaoude :)

If this can wait I will do it later, sorry
no problem @the-mzakrzewski. Yep this is something we need before we can deploy, so I will assign it to myself, thanks for letting me know

title: feat: Added additional property check for homepage in description
body:
## Fixes Issue

Added mentioned fix to description file.
Closes #46 

## Changes proposed

- Added length check for the `repo.homepage` property before the `includes` check.
  - This makes sure the check only moved to the `includes` check when the `homepage` is filled.

Thank you for the contribution. Can you comment on the issue so we can assign it to you, this avoids any confusion with other contributors.

The changes look good, is the PR meant to be in `draft`?
Yeah it was meant as a draft pr atm @eddiejaoude. Wanted to check if I could add a test to validate the behavior in question.

Thank you for checking about the tests! We have Playwright setup but for the authenticated pages, we are setting that up next week. 

So don't worry about the tests for now, we will have to go back and write the tests once we can mock the GitHub OAuth login with Playwright

title: Local Docker
body:
#29

The execution method of the project was changed from `npm run dev` to Docker. New Docker configuration files were added, and the README.md file was updated to reflect these changes. This enables a more uniform development environment and makes the project easier to run.
author: the-mzakrzewski

comments.body: @eddiejaoude I only made this change for local env because I do not know how the deploy process looks.
